column5: We usually ice fish lil sawbill but youll find solitude and alot of fish at big.  No idea why it suddenly gets abandoned during winter???
Lil sawbill just gets hammered. But the fish tend to be a tad bigger, but way harder to locate
Lil sawbill just gets hammered. But the fish tend to be a tad bigger, but way harder to locate   so which one is better?
Imo big. No pressure and lotsa fish. Doesnt hurt we have a camp and fish house there?
Your video is awesome!  Sadly we fisherman in the south are just drooling to get on some safe ice.  Is it going to happen & when?

Imo big. No pressure and lotsa fish. Doesnt hurt we have a camp and fish house there  Big sawbill looks easier to get onto too  What about Saturday? Do you know the ice conditions? I had to drive to Sioux Lookout yesterday, all the big water was WIDE OPEN here.

Your video is awesome!  Sadly we fisherman in the south are just drooling to get on some safe ice.  Is it going to happen & when?  Thanks man, I see a certain Brian guy found some ice somewhere down there.

Super easy to get into lol  But im not sure about the ice??? Its a tiny lake so im hoping its froze over.  Maybe ill just bite the bullet and go check it out.  Be crappy to drive all the way there and find it wide open though lol

Super easy to get into lol  But im not sure about the ice??? Its a tiny lake so im hoping its froze over.  Maybe ill just bite the bullet and go check it out.  Be crappy to drive all the way there and find it wide open though lol   Should be good, if you get a chance would be worth it.
Super cool vid Simon
Wasnt planning on fishing today but if im driving out there might as well gear up lol.  Kids are off to school so im on my way in half hour
Wasnt planning on fishing today but if im driving out there might as well gear up lol.  Kids are off to school so im on my way in half hour  I should just grab my rods and join ya.
Did you fellas get out today?  Lucky ducks.  I'd like to join you both someday if I can ever break away from Southern Ontario. lol  Merry Christmas and good fishing to you both!

Super cool vid Simon   Thanks Joey! And a happy xmas from my crew to yours!    Did you fellas get out today? Lucky ducks.  I'd like to join you both someday if I can ever break away from Southern Ontario. lol  Merry Christmas and good fishing to you both!   Nope, lol…reality set in about half an hour after we hatched the half baked plan, Rick had family stuff and it turned out that I did too….i just didn't know it at the time….lol( school phoned…kid was sick). Saturday is a no go either for Rick, I might have to venture out though.
Yeah that turned out to be a bust?  Hopefully soon though!  Lotsa snow in the forecast so im looking forward to the sled rides too?
Thanks man, I see a certain Brian guy found some ice somewhere down there.

Hi all,  Got out with my buddy Tyler for a session on Eagle Lake. A good 6" of ice all the way across the narrows. Depth from 16' to 22'. Biggest came from 22' but as the light faded the shallower holes saw all the action, iced quite a few, put some back and kept some for supper. glow orange 3/8Oz jigs with live minnows. Good to be out there….just need some snow now so I can get to my Crappie spot.
Starring Rolof,,,,,,,,,,,,,  Your vids are getting better an better Simon. The vid with rolof at the hole was very cool.
Hahaha awesome! Hammered em pretty good dood!  Thats alot of work moving the cameras around etc too  That one small walleye I thought you were gonna smack roloff lol  Great vid and pics???
as Borat would say "very nice!" I SO need to get out fishing... hahaha
Thank god there is ice somewhere. I was starting to get worried.
Simon, any idea if sawbill is frozen yet?  Id guess it has 5-6"  Inbox me lets make a plan(ill even come up to dryden if needed)
Love it! I have always wanted a chocolate lab.
Eyes one after another but, I like the dog playing most.
6" of ice is not in my forecast any time soon!
Sweet vid! Like the underwater shot when you break through the ice
Some great shots in your video Simon. Thanks very much for sharing.

Starring Rolof,,,,,,,,,,,,,  Your vids are getting better an better Simon. The vid with rolof at the hole was very cool.  LOL…..he should get an Oscar! Thanks Brian, It was very easy to mess around with different shots because it was +2C! very different when it is -20 like it should be by now, but I'm not complaining.     Hahaha awesome! Hammered em pretty good dood!  Thats alot of work moving the cameras around etc too  That one small walleye I thought you were gonna smack roloff lol  Great vid and pics  I have wanted to smack Roloff on many occasions…lol…interesting idea, never thought of using a fish before!      as Borat would say "very nice!" I SO need to get out fishing... hahaha  'High Five"(love Borat)     Thank god there is ice somewhere. I was starting to get worried.  Definitely an odd year…again…one extreme to the other.     Simon, any idea if sawbill is frozen yet?  Id guess it has 5-6"  Inbox me lets make a plan(ill even come up to dryden if needed)  Could do it any time you want, I'm off work at the moment. Do you need a quad or snow machine to get onto it, or can you just walk in…remembering that I'm old eh?     Love it! I have always wanted a chocolate lab.  LOL…I got one for sale! (jk)    Eyes one after another but, I like the dog playing most.  He is priceless hey, I realized after finishing the video a third of it is about the dog…love that brown doofus.     6" of ice is not in my forecast any time soon!  This is nuts hey Chad?…soon enough, it has to come.     Sweet vid! Like the underwater shot when you break through the ice  Thanks Lucas, I went all 'Youtube' on this one.    Some great shots in your video Simon. Thanks very much for sharing.  Thanks Tomcat, always appreciate you commenting on my posts
I'm more than a little jealous at the moment.
I'm more than a little jealous at the moment.  Sorry Bruce……but we always get to go first.
We could walk right out  All my spots are withing 2-300 yards
Thanks for sharing that Simon, I really enjoyed it. Roloff did what he was supposed to do and you guys caught some nice fish. Seems like a perfect day to me! HH
Sorry Bruce……but we always get to go first. More so because I don't think we will have decent  ice down here this year.
cool vid. Keep the ice
If I didn't have a doctors appointment on Friday I would be heading up to Eagle Lake after watching your video.  Looks like the dog had just as much fun.
Awesome as always Simon..Just how long of a drive is it from Toronto to Dryden again? lol
+/- 1,700 km according to Google. Too far for me sadly
Its around 20 hours from Toronto.  That's if weather is good and you only stop when you need gas.

We could walk right out  All my spots are withing 2-300 yards  Did you get that snow we got? We could sled out if ya like. Try my new shelter out too.   Thanks for sharing that Simon, I really enjoyed it. Roloff did what he was supposed to do and you guys caught some nice fish. Seems like a perfect day to me! HH  Was a pretty good start to the season…we got some snow today too…things are looking up.    cool vid. Keep the ice  Ah…sure you don't want some?   If I didn't have a doctors appointment on Friday I would be heading up to Eagle Lake after watching your video.  Looks like the dog had just as much fun.  Roloff loves it, he got to chase the snow machine today….he is in heaven!    Awesome as always Simon..Just how long of a drive is it from Toronto to Dryden again? lol   I did it once, I was hallucinating by the time I got to Ignace….lol…over 23 hours.
We got about 6 inches today.  Could def sled out
We got about 6 inches today.  Could def sled out Is it big Sawbill or lillte sawbill?
